list_definition.definition: (used originally of a rocket) a counting backwards to check the time remaining until the beginning of an event, regarded as zero

list_ex_of_english: During the countdown, various holds took 2 hours and 38 minutes.
Depicting a girl counting petals plucked from a daisy, the voiceover changes to a countdown that ends with the mushroom cloud of a muclear explosion.
Once at the launch site, the rocket is erected on the platform, and a three-day countdown is initiated.
Each includes video demos and audio instructions, countdowns and motivational commentary.
Under some circumstances, a countdown may be recycled to an earlier time.
Depending on the type of vehicle used, countdowns can start from 72 to 96 hours before launch time.
Most notably, the countdowns were shorter, with 10 to 15 songs, as opposed to the standard 20 on the current incarnation.
During communications for a countdown, the launch team uses acronyms to keep channels open as much as possible.
